results.title: South East Asia
results.brief_description: A survey of the industry and commerce of Burma, Indo-China, Thailand and Malaya where ancient methods and modes of life contrast sharply with new machinery, schools, highways, modern factories and scientific farming methods. Explains that rice is the basic food crop of the area, and it is also exported in quantities to other countries. Other products include tin, oil, crude rubber and teak.

results.title: South America: votes or violence
results.creator_credit: Anthony Isaacs, Jeremy Isaacs, Intertel and Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Examines the suitability of a democratic form of government for three Latin American countries - Bolivia, Brazil, Chile. It cannot be assumed that their political and economic problems can be solved by Western European methods. Bolivia cannot readily revive its economy based on a barren plateau of worked out mines. Brazil, with greater potential consists of ultra modern, prosperous cities and poverty stricken desert and jungle - should the government develop the profitable sections or tackle the desperate poverty? Chile with similar extremes of wealth, is experimenting with democracy. Written and narrated by James Cameron. Guitarist: John Williams. Intertel is a joint venture of Rediffusion London, Australian Broadcasting Commission, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, National Education T/V and Westinghouse Broadcasting Company of the United States.

results.title: South America: Indians of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans and Art Evans Productions

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 5
results.creator_credit: Wayne Mitchell and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Part five of a series of five on South America, this part visits regions west of the famous Andes. The area is defined as including countries on the narrow strip of land between the Andes Mountains and the Pacific Ocean. It includes Equador, Bolivia, Chile and Peru, all of which are rich is their history of early Amerindian civilization.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 4
results.creator_credit: Wayne Mitchell, BFA Films and Video and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Part four of the five part series on South America travels towards the east of the Andes, exploring the countries of Argentina, Paraquay and Uruguay. The countries share a similar Spanish heritage, but as this video suggests, the similarities end there and each country is unique in its peoples and landscape.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 3
results.creator_credit: Wayne Mitchell, BFA Films and Video and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Part three of a series of five on South America covers the country of Brazil. Most people think of coffee when they hear the word Brazil, but South America’s largest nation is also becoming one of the leading industrially developed countries on the continent. Volume three also covers the importance and influence of Portuguese heritage over the country.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Wayne Mitchell, BFA Films and Video and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Part two of a series of five on South America travels to the Caribbean Coast visiting five countries from the northern region; Venezuela, Colombia, Guyana, Surinam and French Guiana. These countries possess a diversity in people and landscape but share the same warm tropical equator weather.

results.title: Sources of art
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the four basic elements of which all art is composed: line, colour, shape and texture. Natural forms are dissolved into famous works of art. Water-lilies become part of a Manet painting, and swimming trout become part of an ancient Chinese scroll. Paintings by mature artists and paintings by children show that no two artists see the same world in the same way. Paintings photographed at St Louis City Art Museum.

results.title: Source of the Amazon
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: The River Amazon rises in the Andes in Peru not far from the Pacific Ocean and continues for some 4000 miles to the Atlantic Coast in Brazil. The film traces its beginning from the melting snows of the Andes down to the plane country and finally the thick tropical jungle. At Equitos where the river becomes navigable to craft other than canoes the produce of the jungle is brought for transport to the world markets.

results.title: Souperky = Rivals
results.brief_description: Looks at the 11th European Women’s Gymnastics Championships 1977 in Prague. The accomplishments of the competing gymnasts are commented on by young gymnasts - girls aged five to ten who are aiming for the Olympic Games.
